intro: Eulophidium boinense, commonly known as the narrow-leaf grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, a common trait among grasses. Eulophidium boinense plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
